belief has on other ideas;

1216.25.text: the greater the power and influence involved;

1218.56.text:
the more fervently criticism is discouraged
 — particularly by violent means;

1222.56.text:
and the more a belief has a
dehumanising effect,

1227.28.text:
Doesn't get much plainer. We're talking
about the major world religions.

1230.97.text:
The resentments harboured against 
me and others like me,

1234.07.text:
who decline to respect religious
beliefs, are unfounded.

1237.08.text:
I've broken no contract. I give no
special regard to your beliefs,

1241.21.text:
but I ask no special regard for mine.
Beliefs stand or fall on their own merits.

1246.45.text:
I'm not being mean —
criticising unjustified beliefs is important

1250.03.text: because they can lead to real problems.

1252.37.text: If some folks make the mistake

1253.95.text:
of investing their core identity
in an unjustified belief

1257.08.text:
so that when it gets criticised, 
they feel criticised,

1259.94.text: then it's up to them to learn from that mistake —

1262.18.text: not up to everyone else to pay for it.

1264.46.text: And it's not my attitude the causes wars.

1267.09.text: Wars are caused by beliefs like supremacism

1269.77.text:
— the idea that one group is
intrinsically superior to all others.

1273.12.text: Supremacism can be based on many things.

1282.23.text: The scriptures of major world religions

1283.93.text:
like christianity and islam are about
as supremacist as it's possible to be,

1288.25.text: damning all non-members to eternal torture.

1291.27.text:
No earthly supremacist could hope
to achieve sadism on such a scale.

1295.63.text:
For centuries, religious supremacism
has inspired a range of conflict

1299.56.text:
from everyday acts of social discrimination
to colonialism to genocide.

1304.06.text: Beliefs like these are what cause wars.

1306.83.text: And I hope it's now clear

1308.65.text: why I decline to respect them.
